page.title: 02Abbotts Ann village
page.content: Abbotts Ann is a widely spread, pretty village with a population of about 1350. The village contains many picturesque thatched cottages. Many new houses have been built in recent years. In the centre of the village is the school, the village shop/Post Office, the Eagle pub and the village Hall. Recreational facilities include a children's playground and a sports field and pavillion. The Poplar Farm Inn lies on the eastern edge of the village. The Salisbury to Andover bus passes through the village every two hours. The village is surrounded by cultivated land. Watercress beds run along the Pillhill Brook. There are several smallholdings on the northern outskirts which grow strawberries, raspberries, etc.
